intro: Pilosella arvicola subsp. javorinensis, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Pilosella arvicola subsp. javorinensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas across Central and Eastern Europe.
